P. 418.official history (naval and military)07 the russo'-Japanese tar, part hi.Note by the Secretary of the Cabinet.1By desire of the War Office it has been decided to publish the third and final part of the Official History (Naval andMilitary) of the Russo-Japanese War, which was prepared by the historical Section of the Committee of Imperial Defenoe.This work was completed in" 1914, "but owing to the heavy demands on the Stationery Office and the Ordnance Survey Depart-ment it was found impossible to print it off while the late war was in progress.It is not anticipated that the sale will be anything butmeagre, but this is the most interesting and instructive ofthe three volumes and is required for- educational purposes.(Signed) M. P. A. HANKEY.Secretary, Cabinet.2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1,8th January, 1920.
